description: Common enums and other schemas used with requests or datasets.

DatasetTypeEnum.description: Category of a response (dataset) object. Also used in requests. Timestamps in the dataset can either represent real instances of time or typical meteorological year (TMY) or long-term average data. The meaning of timestamps is different in these types.

TimeAlignmentEnum.description: Datetime strings (labels of time intervals) can represent start, center or end of the time interval (or the left edge, the center and the right edge of the time interval).

TimeStepEnum.description: Time step of the datetime column, also known as time resolution or time granularity.

SolarRadiationColumnTypesEnum.description: Column types from the solar data domain (and related). The enum also includes tilted solar irradiation types.
SolarRadiationColumnTypesEnum.$comment: Do not confuse column types with column names, but prefer using type names for column names if applicable.

PvEnergyColumnTypesEnum.description: Column types from the PV energy data domain (and related).

WindEnergyColumnTypesEnum.description: Column types from wind energy data domain.

MeteoColumnTypesEnum.description: Column types from the meteorological data domain.

GeneralColumnTypesEnum.description: Generic types - can occur in datasets, but not in requests.

AllColumnTypes.description: Merging all possible column types together. Used only in the response (datasets).

SolargisSpecialColumnNamesEnum.description: In addition to column type names, Solargis also recognizes the following column names in the request.

SolargisWindHeightColumnNamesPattern.description: Solargis recognized pattern allows to 'suffix' two wind column type names. Wind speed and wind direction can be measured at the predefined height range above the ground (from 50 to 200 meters).

SolargisUncertaintyColumnNamesPattern.description: Solargis recognizes the names of several uncertainty scenarios for selected column types.
SolargisUncertaintyColumnNamesPattern.$comment: Make sure you understand the difference between column names and column types.

AllColumnNames.description: Column names allowed to be used in the response (dataset). See the RequestColumnNames for those allowed in the requests.
AllColumnNames.$comment: Make sure you understand that column type names are subset of all column names.

anyOf.description: Any column type name is valid as column name.
This rule allows providers with arbitrary (unless the pattern matches) column names in datasets.

RequestColumnNames.description: Solargis recognizes these column names in the request.

SolarRadiationUnitsEnum.description: Units used with solar radiation data - either power or energy.

TemperatureUnitsEnum.description: Units used with temperature data - of air, panel surface or a device temperature.

WindSpeedUnitsEnum.description: Units used with wind speed data.

AngularUnitsEnum.description: Various angles - used in wind direction, solar geometry, panels, etc.

PressureUnitsEnum.description: Units used with the air pressure.

PrecipitationUnitsEnum.description: Units used with water vapour, rain and snow.

AllUnits.description: Convenience schema - merging all possible units.

QualityControlStatusEnum.description: Types of the QC status entity.
